programme.title: Us
programme.desc: Accompanied by her husband, son and daughter, Adelaide Wilson returns to the beachfront home where she grew up as a child. Haunted by a traumatic experience from the past, Adelaide grows increasingly concerned that something bad is going to happen. Her worst fears soon become a reality when four masked strangers descend upon the house, forcing the Wilsons into a fight for survival. When the masks come off, the family is horrified to learn that each attacker takes the appearance of one of them.

programme.title: Wolf Man
programme.desc: Attacked by an unseen animal, Blake and his family barricade themselves inside a farmhouse as the creature prowls the perimeter. As the night stretches on, however, he begins to behave strangely, transforming into something unrecognizable.

programme.title: A Quiet Place
programme.desc: A family must navigate their lives in silence to avoid mysterious creatures that hunt by sound. Knowing that even the slightest whisper or footstep can bring death, a couple protect their children while desperately searching for a way to fight back.

programme.title: A Quiet Place: Day One
programme.desc: When New York City comes under attack from an alien invasion, a woman and other survivors try to find a way to safety. They soon learn that they must remain absolutely silent as the mysterious creatures are drawn to the slightest sound.

programme.title: Ma
programme.desc: A lonely middle-aged woman befriends some teenagers and decides to let them party at her house. Just when the kids think their luck couldnt get any better, things start happening that make them question the intention of their host.

programme.title: IT
programme.desc: Seven young outcasts in Derry, Maine, are about to face their worst nightmare -- an ancient, shape-shifting evil that emerges from the sewer every 27 years to prey on the towns children. Banding together over the course of one horrifying summer, the friends must overcome their own personal fears to battle the murderous, bloodthirsty clown known as Pennywise.

programme.title: Gothika
programme.desc: A strange car accident leaves criminal psychiatrist Miranda with amnesia and locked up in her own prison, accused of murdering her own husband, the director of the hospital. Haunted by terrifying spirits, she must escape to save her sanity.

programme.title: The Nun
programme.desc: When a young nun at a cloistered abbey in Romania takes her own life, a priest with a haunted past and a novice on the threshold of her final vows are sent by the Vatican to investigate. Together, they uncover the orders unholy secret. Risking not only their lives but their faith and their very souls, they confront a malevolent force in the form of a demonic nun.

programme.title: Annabelle
programme.desc: A possessed doll that was purchased for their new born child creates havoc, and destroys a young couples lives.

programme.title: Annabelle: Creation
programme.desc: Years after the tragic death of their daughter, a former toy maker and his wife welcome a nun and six orphaned girls into their farmhouse. Terror soon strikes when one child finds a seemingly innocent doll that appears to have a life of its own.

programme.title: Halloween
programme.desc: Its been 40 years since Laurie Strode survived a vicious attack from crazed killer Michael Myers on Halloween night. She now faces a terrifying showdown when the masked madman returns to Haddonfield, Illinois, but this time, Lauries ready for him.

programme.title: Hollow Man
programme.desc: After years of experimentation, brilliant but arrogant scientist Sebastian Caine has discovered a way to make matter invisible. Determined to achieve the ultimate breakthrough, Caine pushes his team to move to the next phase - using himself as the subject. The test is a success, but when the process cant be reversed, Caine seems doomed to a future without flesh.

programme.title: Hollow Man
programme.desc: After years of experimentation, brilliant but arrogant scientist Sebastian Caine has discovered a way to make matter invisible. Determined to achieve the ultimate breakthrough, Caine pushes his team to move to the next phase - using himself as the subject. The test is a success, but when the process cant be reversed, Caine seems doomed to a future without flesh.

programme.title: Lawless
programme.desc: Set in Depression-era Franklin County, Virginia, a bootlegging gang is threatened by a new deputy and other authorities who want a cut of their profits.

programme.title: Mob Cops
programme.desc: When a retired NYPD detective writes a book about his familys ties to the mob, it ignites a firestorm between dirty cops working for a brutal crime boss and the officers trying to bring them to justice.

programme.title: Angels and Demons
programme.desc: Having ruffled the feathers of the Catholic Church with his controversial investigations into Christian history, Harvard symbologist Robert Langdon is surprised to be approached by the Popes emissaries for help. Following the Popes recent death, the four candidates most likely to take the pontiffs place have been kidnapped by a mysterious organisation known as the Illuminati.

programme.title: Psycho
programme.desc: Gus Van Sants remake of the Hitchcock classic about an embezzler who checks into a remote motel run by a psychopath. While remaining faithful to the original, the modern setting and slightly more explicit shots than the censor would allow in Hitchcocks day make this a fascinating exercise that compares favourably to the original.

programme.title: Black Bag
programme.desc: When his beloved wife, Kathryn, is suspected of betraying the nation, intelligence agent George Woodhouse faces the ultimate test -- loyalty to his marriage or his country.

programme.title: Juror #2
programme.desc: A juror for a high-profile murder trial finds himself struggling with a serious moral dilemma that could influence the verdict and potentially convict, or free, the accused killer.

programme.title: The Accountant
programme.desc: A mild mannered, socially weird government accountant moonlights as a highly trained, and deadly assassin.

programme.title: Jack Reacher
programme.desc: A defence attorney hires an enigmatic ex-Army investigator to tackle the case of a highly trained sniper who apparently murdered five people at random.

programme.title: Jack Reacher: Never Go Back
programme.desc: Investigator Jack Reacher goes on the lam to uncover the truth behind a major government conspiracy that involves the death of U.S. soldiers.

When Cassandra announces that autumn is almost here and she will soon leave, Bao Bao is upset at her imminent departure and prepares himself for life without her. Bao Bao learns that Cassandra is only leaving for the winter months, and he should make the most of her company while he can.

programme.sub-title: The Story of the Savannah Craze

The other animals on the savannah are tired and soon go to bed. Can the mischievous monkeys find ways to keep themselves awake all night and still enjoy their birthday?

programme.title: 64 Zoo Lane
programme.sub-title: The Story of a the Record-Breaking Puffins

programme.title: 64 Zoo Lane
programme.sub-title: The Story of Ronald and His Boulders
programme.desc: Ronald the rhinos favourite pastime is bashing boulders - but one day he realises there are no more boulders left to bash on the savannah. Ronald sets out to find something else to bash - with almost catastrophic consequences.

programme.title: 64 Zoo Lane
programme.sub-title: The Story of the House of Leaves
programme.desc: Nelson the elephant wants to build the biggest and best house of leaves ever. His nephew Nigel is eager to help out, but Nelson is worried that the leaf house might be too fragile for his exuberant young nephew. When the house of leaves comes crashing down, Nelson wastes no time in telling Nigel off.

programme.title: 64 Zoo Lane
programme.sub-title: The Story of Gertie the Goat
programme.desc: Gertie the goat has agreed to take Bao Bao the panda on a climbing expedition up the So Hi Mountains. The other animals advise Gertie against the trip, since pandas are not renowned for their climbing skills. Will Gertie and Bao Bao prove the others wrong, or will they need some help from their friends?

programme.title: 64 Zoo Lane
programme.sub-title: The Story of the Jungle Ball
programme.desc: The Jungle Ball is imminent and all the animals are busy finding their dance partners for the night. All except Reginald - nobody has ever asked him to dance with them at the Jungle Ball. He sets off in search of a dance partner, but has he left it too late?

programme.title: 64 Zoo Lane
programme.sub-title: The Story of the Great Rains

programme.title: 64 Zoo Lane
programme.desc: Nelson is in an inventive mood, and agrees to make various objects for his friends. Alan the aardvark is excited about the scooter that Nelson is making him - even though he doesnt really know what a scooter is. The other animals all take it in turns to help deliver the scooter to Alan, each making their own modifications to the vehicle on the way. Alan is delighted when his very own scooter eventually arrives.

programme.title: 64 Zoo Lane
programme.sub-title: The Story of Reginalds New Look

programme.title: 64 Zoo Lane
programme.desc: It is Washi-Washi day in the So Hi Mountains, when all the animals wash and groom themselves until they are squeaky and clean. programme.desc: Exploring the life and crimes of American serial killer William `Bill Suff.

programme.title: Nothing to Declare
programme.desc: Officers suspect a Brazilian man is lying to them and the truth may lay in his bag. A Chinese student in a hurry attracts the attention of Biosecurity officers.

programme.title: Nothing to Declare
programme.desc: Things go from bad to worse for a young man when drugs are found in his bag and his fiancee is left further unimpressed by what is revealed next.

programme.title: The Slow Mo Guys Big Adventures
programme.desc: A look at how flaming arrows worked and whether armour was effective against archers.

programme.title: Big Cats: Wild Files
programme.desc: As Patrick Aryee continues his search for the ultimate big cat, he takes a closer look at a secretive feline who is a master of the trees, the clouded leopard.

programme.title: Wheres Wally?
programme.desc: When Whitebeard attempts to magically enhance his voice for a singing duet with an old Wizard friend, he accidentally switches bodies with Arf.

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: The ship is thrown into chaos when Counsellor Troi and her mother are kidnapped by the Ferengi.

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: In order to stabilise a severely injured humanoid who is found in the Enterprises escape pod, Geordi volunteers to have his nervous system linked to that of the stranger. However, the complicated process breaks down.

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: The Enterprise has a deadly encounter with the Borg, resulting in Picards kidnap, while Commander Riker encounters a beautiful rival with an eye on his job.

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Kidnapped and assimilated by the Borg, Captain Picard is trapped aboard their ship. At the helm of the Enterprise, Riker is faced with a momentous decision.

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: While docking for repairs at an Earth station, the crew has an opportunity to visit their families, an experience that is particularly painful for Captain Picard.

programme.title: The Reluctant Royal
programme.desc: Philadelphia mechanic Johnny learns his estranged father is a duke. The duke surprises him, as do his feelings for advisor Prudence.

programme.title: Micro Monsters With David Attenborough
programme.desc: Right beneath our feet is a secret world of disguise and espionage, social networking and courtship, rape and pillage, parenthood and relationships. Sir David Attenborough investigates how macroscopic residents outwit their enemies to survive.

programme.title: Micro Monsters With David Attenborough
programme.desc: Its a bug-eating world out there, and the documentary continues with a look at how the various critters disable the defences of their respective prey.

programme.title: Great Barrier Reef with David Attenborough
programme.desc: David descends beneath the waves at night in the state of the art Triton submersible, the first of its kind to visit the reef. He meets some of the tiny coral animals that built the reef and helped to turn it into an underwater wonderland.

programme.title: Age of Big Cats
programme.desc: Changes the planet has undergone affects big cats, from the almost complete disappearance of American wildlife to the rise of man, and threatens their survival.

programme.title: Agatha Raisin
programme.desc: Back in her quaint Cotswolds hamlet, Agatha suspects her hair salons arrogant stylist is blackmailing clients with their darkest secrets.

programme.title: Agatha Raisin
programme.desc: The beauty salon case continues for Agatha as she digs deeper into a charming hair stylists crimes.

programme.title: Rob and Romesh Vs...
programme.desc: Comedian mates Rob Beckett and Romesh Ranganathan head to Jamaica to meet sprint legend Usain Bolt, the fastest man ever to have lived.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride directs the team to link Sasha to the recent attacks in New Orleans; Carter and Tammy search for a stolen highly trained military dog; Pride and Rita make an important decision about their wedding.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride and Rita plan their wedding; the FBI arrests Connor in connection to the bars firebombing.

programme.title: Caught on Dashcam
programme.desc: Counts down some of the most incredible, spectacular and hilarious real life crashes in the world. Video cameras capture massive pile ups, road rage and misguided overtaking manoeuvres.

programme.title: Night Cops
programme.desc: Documentary series exploring the work of police officers across the UK.

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: A frightening case of road rage unfolds as a drunk man attacks another car with an axe, and a truck takes out a car in spectacular fashion.

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: A pedestrian is lucky to be alive after a stroll down the motorway, and a commuter spies another driver doing something he shouldnt.

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: When a truck crashes the driver tries to lie his way out of trouble, unaware that cameras have caught it all.

programme.title: Dogs With Extraordinary Jobs
programme.desc: Dogs are using their remarkable scenting skills for lifesaving conservation and pro-active environmental policing. In Canada, a team of canine detectives is sniffing out the destructive invasive zebra mussel.

programme.title: Wildest New Zealand
programme.desc: New Zealands isolated islands are famed as an unusual paradise, home to a variety of unique wildlife. Best known for its flightless birds, ancient reptiles and coastal mammals, a closer look reveals another world. A land of miniature monsters, Lilliputian predators and tiny terrors that lead remarkable lives, where every hunter is also the hunted and survival is always a giant struggle. Journey into the undergrowth and discover life on a different scale.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs. Pride
programme.desc: Return to South Luangwa to see the new pups born to the mighty Manzi and the tiny-but-fearless Kakumbi packs. See yearling Snowy face a hungry hyena before a lion pride scatters Manzi mum Wekas pups and leaves her frantically searching for them.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs. Pride
programme.desc: Run into a lion-hyena showdown with Julz as he hunts for the elusive Manzi pack, who are missing four of their precious pups. Then join Henry from the Zambian Carnivore Programme on a house call to the Kakumbi den, where another pup has gone AWOL.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs. Pride
programme.desc: Julz and park scout Simon track the Kakuli pack who they filmed previously, and a Manzi faction whove ditched a tracking collar and broken away from the group. The Kakumbi making a kill before a happy Manzi reunion.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs. Pride
programme.desc: Encountering an elephant as Julz and Henry track the Kakumbi pups who face off with a stubborn, razor-tusked warthog. ZCPs lion specialist Thandie Mweetwa counts the prides that are pushing the Manzi out of their territory.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs. Pride
programme.desc: The Kakumbi see a leopard whos been stalking them, Julz goes fishing with Simon, explores mealtime pack hierarchy and witnesses a heartbreaking vigil for a badly injured Kakumbi pup.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs. Pride
programme.desc: Heading back to the den with the Kakumbi who are mourning the loss of two pups. A look at a hyena den and lion pride trying to take down a buffalo and catching up with the Manzi who are in a standoff with a leopard and a herd of angry elephants.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.desc: Ethiopias Awash National Park is home to a closely knit group where aggression plays a vital role in ensuring strong family bonds and structure. Their daily challenges with each other and the environment of Awash give way to a fascinating society.

programme.title: Coral City
programme.desc: Adapt or perish in the coral streets as higher-than-normal temperatures make autumn cooling (and survival) more difficult. Shack up with a clownfish family and their sea anemone landlord, then see cleaner fish give manta rays a day at the spa.

programme.title: Coral City
programme.desc: Get chills as winter descends, slowing down life on the bustling reef. Meander with reef sharks and octopuses, visit a coral oasis atop an old shipwreck and more.

programme.title: Wild Battleground
programme.desc: Discover how different animals use the terrain to their advantage and their unique attributes to defeat their opponents at each location, becoming masters of communication, camouflage, diplomacy and combat.

programme.title: Wild Battleground
programme.desc: Discover how different animals use the terrain to their advantage and their unique attributes to defeat their opponents at each location, becoming masters of communication, camouflage, diplomacy and combat.

programme.title: Shark With Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve explores the radical variety of sharks in the Atlantic Ocean and marks the start of a global journey in the so-called shark capital of the world, the Bahamas.

programme.title: Shark With Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Take a look behind the scenes as naturalist and shark-lover Steve Backshall gets up close and personal with these amazing creatures.

programme.title: Micro Monsters With David Attenborough
programme.desc: Right beneath our feet is a secret world of disguise and espionage, social networking and courtship, rape and pillage, parenthood and relationships. Sir David Attenborough investigates how macroscopic residents outwit their enemies to survive.

programme.title: David Attenboroughs First Life
programme.desc: Sir David Attenborough journeys across the globe to discover how the earliest animals developed on our planet. Attenborough meets expert fossil hunters, and sees on-site some of the most remarkable finds that have transformed our understanding of the first animal life forms, including the first set of eyes and teeth and the first predators and parasites.

programme.title: David Attenboroughs First Life
programme.desc: Sir David Attenboroughs journey continues in Canadas Rocky Mountains, where fossils document an explosion in animal diversity never seen before or since. Travelling on to North Africa, the rainforests of Australia and the east coast of Scotland, Attenborough discovers how animals evolved to conquer not only the oceans but also the land and air.

programme.title: Battle of the Alphas
programme.desc: From turf wars, to food fights, to mating mayhem, nature is all about competition and the quest to be the best. Every day, the planet is a battleground as animals go head to head with their own kind.

programme.title: Battle of the Alphas
programme.desc: From turf wars, to food fights, to mating mayhem, nature is all about competition and the quest to be the best. Every day, the planet is a battleground as animals go head to head with their own kind.

programme.title: Surviving the Amazon
programme.desc: Each year, more than 200,000 monkeys in Peru are trafficked illegally, and almost all are babies. Follow these little ones as they learn to survive alone.

programme.title: Americas Wild Seasons
programme.desc: Across the continent, the land and its wildlife breathe in warmth and renewal. For some animals, courtship rituals begin to heat up as battles for dominance break out. For others, its the time to tend to brand new life.

programme.title: Americas Wild Seasons
programme.desc: Summer is the time of plenty across America. Its a chance for animals to reap natures bounty while they can. The years young begin to explore their world, while new parents make use of the long days to make sure they grow up strong.

programme.desc: Bees are one of the most important species on the planet. Follow the trials and tribulations of two particular honeybees over two years from birth to death.

programme.title: Wild Survivors
programme.desc: The drive to reproduce is the one of the most primal forces in nature. It dictates how any given species will behave for most of its life. There are over a hundred thousand species of animal in Africa, so there are countless strategies to find a mate.

programme.title: Wild Survivors
programme.desc: Finding food is the most immediate need for any animal. Food is the fuel that gives an animal strength to fight, or to flee. But in the Luangwa valley the dry season is at its height and the landscape has become cruel and barren.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.sub-title: Hyenas and Lions: Life in the Leftovers
programme.desc: The two top carnivore species.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.desc: Every day a struggle for survival plays out across Africa. Predators binge on the dead and natures undertakers circle above waiting for their chance.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.desc: Their ancestors were the first vertebrates to colonise dry land and frogs inhabit every continent except Antarctica, but their world is rapidly changing. What was once wetlands are now playgrounds, golf courses and race tracks.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.desc: Once abundant on the continent, elephant populations have been drastically reduced by hunting for ivory and meat in the last 200 years. Yet there are pockets of hope for these giants, found in elephant conservation reserves like Addo Elephant Park.

programme.title: Wild Battleground
programme.desc: Discover how different animals use the terrain to their advantage and their unique attributes to defeat their opponents at each location, becoming masters of communication, camouflage, diplomacy and combat.

programme.title: Wild Battleground
programme.desc: In oceans, lakes, and rivers, there are underwater war zones. There are also some creatures that have brutal skirmishes above the waves that determine who wins and who dies.

programme.desc: Steve explores a world of sharks right on your doorstep. Meet everything from Basking sharks to Angelsharks which have never been filmed before, and discover the threats these sharks face.

programme.title: Monkeys and More: Our Closest Relatives
programme.desc: Ever wonder how closely related humans, monkeys, and apes really are? Visit primate habitats to get an intimate look into their complex societies and observe these intelligent animals loving, working, loafing, fighting, and sharing just like we do.

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: The vets are called over concerns for the health of young chimp, Bart. The woolly monkey move continues with eleven of the primates swapping homes in one day.

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Alison responds to a request from the police to rescue a neglected marmoset. The siamang gibbons have a training session and its pumpkins in the mist for the chimps.

programme.sub-title: United States Grand Prix: Sprint Qualifying
programme.desc: The United States Grand Prix stages the fourth Sprint Qualifying session of 2025 as grid positions are set for the F1 Sprint Race, where the fastest driver here will claim pole.

programme.desc: Marge and some friends organise a protest against the male population of Springfield after they become obsessed with Mixed Martial Arts.

programme.desc: Marge poses for a calendar for charity, but she is soon the gossip of the city after she shows a little too much during her photo shoot.

programme.title: Coral City
programme.desc: Adapt or perish in the coral streets as higher-than-normal temperatures make autumn cooling (and survival) more difficult. Shack up with a clownfish family and their sea anemone landlord, then see cleaner fish give manta rays a day at the spa.

programme.title: Coral City
programme.desc: Get chills as winter descends, slowing down life on the bustling reef. Meander with reef sharks and octopuses, visit a coral oasis atop an old shipwreck and more.

programme.desc: We sit down with Duncan Ferguson to discuss the fierce, passionate, and often unpredictable career of one of Evertons most legendary figures. programme.desc: Shopping from home.

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillos nineteenth-century Appletons guidebook leads him to the Parker House Hotel, where in his best pinny, he whisks up a Boston cream pie. In the fine dome atop Massachusetts General Hospital, where no-one could hear the screaming, Michael discovers the scene of grisly surgery, first made bearable, in 1846, by a miraculous new substance. North of Boston, in Salem, Michael is caught up in a witch hunt.

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Guided by his Appletons and tracing the footsteps of the Pilgrim Fathers, Michael Portillo heads for Plymouth, the `home town of America. He learns how indigenous tribes of Wamponoag people taught newly arrived settlers to live off the land, inspiring one of the biggest holidays in todays American calendar.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: In Massachusetts, the guys try to broker a deal on an original Bowie knife and discover a Hollywood collection containing rare photos of Marilyn Monroe.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys arrive in Texas and learn more about what the Lone Star State has to offer them, from stubborn customers, to a "coyote killer".

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: Bangers and Cash spin-off series that follows the journey of a vehicle purchased at a Mathewsons classic car auction, before being repaired, restored and re-auctioned.

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor is convinced he is going insane after being trapped in a shed by a swarm of bees, he is stuck in the opticians for a day with his eyes shut, and then left to babysit some unruly children.

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor takes up drawing at a life class, but Margarets enthusiasm for his new hobby wanes when she discovers that he has given the model a lift home.

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.sub-title: The Return of the Speckled Band
programme.desc: Before the Meldrews can leave for their holiday in Athens, they must cope with Victors fear of flying, Mrs Warboys food poisoning, and a snake on the loose.

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: An artistic dispute with the Meldrews threatens to scupper Patricks plans for a quiet birthday, and Pippa finds herself in an adulterous affair.

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor wades through four nightmares, first with a local theatre group, then with his new car, digestive troubles and Mildreds accidental death.

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Katy the cleaner writes a play about her larger-than-life employers, and Mrs Warboys has an unspeakable ordeal in the Meldews bathroom.

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Building of Britain
programme.desc: Fred Dibnah takes his series on the building of Britain to his home turf - Lancashire - so he can wax lyrical over the roots of the nations canal network. He visits Worsley to see where it all began and, in his own back garden, and demonstrates the early canal-building process. Fred then takes a trip on the Leeds-Liverpool waterway, revealing the hard work and skill that made such a passage possible.

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Building of Britain
programme.desc: Fred Dibnah shows how steam-powered machinery helped build Herefordshires Eastnor Castle, and takes a look at the work of Augustus Welby Pugin, the architect whose buildings - such as the Palace of Westminster - were inspired by medieval gothic architecture.

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs World of Steam, Steel and Stone
programme.desc: Series in which the late Lancastrian steeplejack Fred Dibnah traces the development of industrialisation in Britain. He looks back at some of the sites he visited over the past eight years, such as Queen Street Mill, Ironbridge, the Long Shop Museum and the Black Country Living Museum.

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs World of Steam, Steel and Stone
programme.desc: Fred Dibnah described himself as a back street mechanic and believed he was awarded his MBE and honorary doctorates for this reason. His garden was all assembled from scrap and the cast-offs from old mills and factories, but it was probably the finest working example of a steam-powered engineering workshop in the country.

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Made in Britain
programme.desc: Fred stops off at Andy Thorntons, a company that makes ornate carvings, moves on to Worsborough to have a go at making hot forge rivets, then travels down to Derbyshire to visit the Midland Railway Centre.

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Made in Britain
programme.desc: Leaving the engine to be fixed, Fred visits David Ragsdale, a skilled pattern maker who just happens to own six steam engines. He then meets a man who runs a garden centre and museum with the power of steam.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek and Paul are off to Leeds on a rare father and son road trip to pick up a VW Cabriolet and a Lotus Elite.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A beautiful looking sports car has been fooling the punters and intriguing Derek. Its a Challenger E-Type - a fibreglass replica created from an E-Type mould.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: Bangers and Cash spin-off series that follows the journey of a vehicle purchased at a Mathewsons classic car auction, before being repaired, restored and re-auctioned.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Paul and Jack head to Staffordshire to pick up five vehicles from collector Robs colossal barn, including a Mini and a Morris Minor.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Theres an unlikely arrival at the North Yorkshire car auction - an Argentinian Army Mercedes G wagon that saw action in the Falklands War.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek has three scooters to collect, while also finding room for a Daimler and a teardrop caravan.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek makes his way to Blackpool to pick up what will be the highest priced item at the next auction. But, the 1970 Aston Martin DBS needs a tow to the local garage.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Over the years Derek has learnt to always expect the unexpected. So when Call the Midwife star, Cliff Parisi, drops off his Bedford CA campervan its just another day at the office.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash

As preparations for the new show progress, will Rahul decide on a happy ending?

programme.title: Vijay
programme.desc: A widower, Lala, is dismayed to find out that both his children plan to marry people of lower classes. Lala gives his sons pregnant fiancee a blank cheque and asks her to leave, but 25 years go by before the cheque is cashed, and Lala sets out to find out why.
